alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued February 25 at 10:22AM AKST until February 26 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM AKST SATURDAY ALONG THE KUSKOKWIM DELTA COAST... * WHAT...South to southeast winds 40 to 55 mph with gusts up to 70 mph expected. * WHERE...Along the Kuskokwim Delta Coast. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 9 AM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...High winds may move loose debris, damage property, and cause power outages. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...An unusual wind event is shaping up for this time of year. Expect gusty east to northeast winds to increase through the day today. Through this evening, winds will shift abruptly out of the south-southeast. The strongest corridor of winds will move right up the coast overnight Friday into Saturday morning. Due to the unusual track of the storm for this time of year, there remains a fair degree of uncertainty, so stay tuned to the details. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... People are urged to secure loose objects that could be blown around or damaged by the wind. Prepare for the possibility of widespread power outages. Use caution if you must drive. &&
